description: Dive into "Romantic Escapes in Enchanting Basel" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Romantic Escapes in Enchanting Basel

places.generalDescription: Kannenfeldpark, located in Basel, Switzerland, is a family-friendly park with various attractions for all ages. Once a graveyard, it now offers a peaceful escape from the city's hustle and bustle. The park features modern play areas, a seasonal splash pool with fountains, and an outdoor cafe. It spans 10 hectares and hosts popular summer events and celebrations. Visitors can enjoy picnics in the spacious grassy areas or relax in the beautiful rose garden.

sources.snippet: Kannenfeldpark: Escape the bustling city and learn about nature at this peaceful park. The lush greenery, serene lake, and charming bridges create a dreamy atmosphere for romantic snapshots.
sources.shortName: Vibrant Basel ‚Äì Walking Tour for Couples

places.name: Kannenfeldpark

reviews.text: Beautiful park to play around with kids, do some sports, and also just chill. Many squirrels around. In the autumn, the leaves' colors are just pure beauty. Highly recommended any time of the year.

We must thank Basel governing authorities for maintaining such a vast and beautiful park in the city. It has a bus and tram connection to it from various points. I think more than ten play spots are available exclusively for children.

I appreciate the meticulously planned vast green grass spaces with chairs for elderly people. Looking at those tall and bulky trees I feel small and humble.

There is a small structure erected in memory of war veterans inside the park. It lists the names of those soldiers during two different periods. A one page write up with precise details may help tourists like me to understand the importance of this memorial.

There is a cafeteria and also WC. It is a must to visit this park for those with small kids, children or adults or elderly. Once again, I appreciate the Basel Municipality for maintaining such an amazing park
Large, peaceful, open space where you can see red squirrels. Plenty of areas for the kids to enjoy. A cafe is situated there and there are plenty of options to sit back and relax.

places.generalDescription: The Merian G√§rten botanical garden is a beautiful, peaceful and well-maintained garden with a large collection of Iris flowers. It's also home to other lovely exhibits such as the English Garden, the Rhododendron Valley and Minigolf. However, the garden does not allow dogs inside so be sure to bring your furry friend along if you're visiting!

sources.snippet: In the 18-hectare Merian Gardens, you can relax amidst flowers, herbs and trees. Animal lovers and climbing monkeys will be delighted by the sheep, rabbits and chickens and the adventure playground. The public Sch√ºtzenmattpark is a paradise for splashing and romping with extensive lawns and small play islands, park benches under beautiful old trees and a pavilion with a caf√©.
sources.shortName: Spring Basel City Break | Offers & Tips

places.name: Merian Gardens

reviews.text:
Very pretty garden to have a relaxing walk. Went in summer and couldn't see much flowers but in spring must be even more pretty!
Dogs are not allowed
Beautiful,  family friendly,  gorgeous cafe, little kids farm, spielplatz, carp fish pond, little paths and streams with plenty to explore and run around :)

Unfortunately I was there on a cloudy day, but the place was still beautiful for a walk. You can see many flowers, lots of green‚Ä¶ and you can stop for a bite or drink in two different places! It's not so close to the city center, but it's worth it if you have some extra time in Basel.

places.generalDescription: Restaurant Stucki - Tanja Grandits offers a refined yet relaxed dining experience in the Bruderholz neighborhood. Chef Tanja Grandits presents her unique 'aroma kitchen' style, featuring imaginative dishes with contrasting flavors and textures, such as wasabi mousse and green tea guacamole. Guests can enjoy the nine-course 'Aroma Menu' or opt for the more affordable lunchtime menus.

sources.snippet: The ambience in the historic villa with its garden contributes to a visit to Stucki that will stay with you for a long time.
sources.shortName: The 10 best romance restaurants in Basel

places.name: Restaurant Stucki - Tanja Grandits

reviews.text:
The culinary journey that was the nine course menu was pure bliss. Each dish presented was a masterpiece, both visually stunning and bursting with exquisite flavors. Chef Tanja Grandits's innovative approach to cuisine shines through in every bite, showcasing a harmonious blend of textures and tastes.

The service was impeccable, with a knowledgeable and attentive staff who guided me through the menu with expertise and warmth. The attention to detail and genuine passion for hospitality were evident throughout the entire meal, making me feel truly valued as a guest.
The ambiance of the restaurant was equally impressive, with a refined yet welcoming atmosphere.

It is a true gem in Basel's culinary scene, and I cannot recommend it highly enough for anyone seeking an extraordinary dining experience. I left Stucki feeling not only satisfied but also inspired by the culinary artistry and hospitality displayed by Chef Tanja and her team.

To be honest i was a little disappointed. First of all the good points.
-if you ask questions they are dutifully answered and even though they tried to accommodate your requests as good as possible.
-the food was mostly very very good. A few dishes were not fitting into the concept somehow but overall superb quality of cooking
-when mentioned we had some books to sign we were even shown the patisserie.
-the armosphere was amazing.

The things which didn't go so well:
-the wine pairing was completely out of synch with dinner. They poured the next wine before we even finished the last one.
-the amouse bouche was somehow in a weird order and the one we tried first was overwhelming every taste.
-the first starter was absolutely not fitting.
-the apero was extraordinary expensive. This is something which bothers me generally. They never tell you how much an apero will cost even though it is important and 35 per glass is outrageous if you only get it on the bill.
-we paid 1200 chf for two people and for that it wasn't good enough to be honest. Most expensive star experience so far and i think other ones were much better.

We had lunch here and it was a feast. Every dish was very pretty yet never exaggerated. No artificial show elements. It is all about taste and textures. The cutlery and plating are even downright simple, nothing special, but you don‚Äòt eat out to see knives and forks. Tanja greeted us at our table which was very nice. The atmosphere is pleasant, no music! Most guests seem to be locals having a regular lunch on a weekday, apparently the neighborhood is rich.

places.generalDescription: The Palatinate (Pfalz) Viewing Platform is a must-visit spot in Basel, offering breathtaking views of the Rhine River and the town. Located above the M√ºnster jetty, it provides an ideal vantage point to admire the rows of houses on the right bank in Kleinbasel. The terrace also boasts ornate ledgerstones dating back to the 1500s, adding a historical touch to its charm.

sources.snippet: Stroll to the Basel Minster and enjoy views over the Rhine from the Palatinate Viewing Platform. Revel in the whimsy of the Tinguely Fountain, where art and motion create a playful atmosphere. Experience the elegance of Theater Basel, a venue for captivating performances and shared cultural experiences.
sources.shortName: 2-hour romantic tour in Basel

places.name: Basler Pfalz

reviews.text:
Palatinate Viewing Platform offers a magnificent experience to those who love the beauty of nature and architecture. Located on a hill, the platform offers outstanding views of the picturesque Rhine region.

The architecture of the platform harmonizes with the environment, allowing a perfect immersion in nature. With its commanding view of green hills, quaint towns and surrounding vineyards, it is an ideal place to observe the views at different times of the day.

Tucked behind the majestic Basel Minster, this elevated platform offers breathtaking panoramic views over the Rhine River, the charming rooftops of Kleinbasel, and on clear days, even stretches to the Black Forest in Germany and the Vosges in France.

It's the perfect spot to pause and soak in the city's beauty-whether you're watching ferries glide across the river, admiring the sunset, or simply enjoying a peaceful moment under the shade of old trees. The terrace is open 24/7 and free to access, making it an ideal stop any time of day.

This little spot was suggested to me by our hotel clerk. She told me I'd get an excellent view over Little Basel. It was as described. A picturesque spot.
There were bonuses too. The church, the cloisters and the location to walk around all provided a GG ood spot to enjoy.

HINT: Either go down the side of the church or via the side entrance and through the back.

It is worth a stop.

places.generalDescription: The Theater Basel is a family-friendly venue that offers a variety of entertainment options for both kids and adults. It hosts children's shows, outdoor theater events, and workshops. The theater's unique architecture includes a cafe on the top floor and an auditorium that seamlessly flows into the stage area without barriers. Visitors can enjoy watching rehearsals while kids play freely around the building.

sources.snippet: Experience the elegance of Theater Basel, a venue for captivating performances and shared cultural experiences. Admire the grandeur of Stadtcasino Basel, a symbol of Basel's rich musical heritage. Conclude your tour at Barf√ºsserplatz, a historic square that comes alive with the vibrancy of Basel's modern love and nightlife.
sources.shortName: Romantic Whispers of Basel: A Love-Filled Journey in Basel

sources.snippet: Experience the elegance of Theater Basel, a venue for captivating performances and shared cultural experiences. Admire the grandeur of Stadtcasino Basel, a symbol of Basel‚Äôs rich musical heritage. Conclude your tour at Barf√ºsserplatz, a historic square that comes alive with the vibrancy of Basel‚Äôs nightlife.
sources.shortName: 2-hour romantic tour in Basel

sources.snippet: Experience the elegance of Theater Basel, a venue renowned for captivating performances and shared cultural experiences. Admire the architecture as you pass by this important cultural landmark.
sources.shortName: 2-hour romantic tour in Basel

places.name: Theater Basel

reviews.text: Really great! So wonderful performance. Every detail is working for some purpose. Totally recommend to visit. Usually the prices are 30-145 CHF, but I think you can find cheaper with coupon or something.

I adore the openness of the theater hall. The last time I had a similar feeling was in Oslo. If you like the open air, you can sit next to the Tinguely Fountain. It's a complex with different stages and I watched 1984 in the Schauspielhaus. So you can check the stage name in advance but no need to worry as everything is close. The ballet will change artistic direction next season, so there will be more ballets than physical theaters/performances. Check the program and see if you can find something you like.

Very good theater, interesting space, good organisation‚Ä¶ Except it was not clear that there are two separate buildings with entries 5min away one from another. We asked the personal to verify that we were at the right place, but due to some misunderstanding we almost lost the start of the performance although being in the theatre one hour in advance.

It is noticeable that there are tensions among the artistic personal and the administration and it is currently undergoing a change of direction.

Looking forward to come back and see some other excellent pieces!

places.generalDescription: The University of Basel Botanical Garden, established in the 16th century, is a serene oasis nestled in the heart of Basel. This historic garden showcases a diverse array of plant specimens and features picturesque grounds along with four greenhouses. Visitors can explore an impressive collection of cacti and orchids, as well as immerse themselves in the lush tropical environment within the tropical house.
places.name: University of Basel Botanical Garden

reviews.text: A little beautiful garden with a lot to see. Small trails in-between the plants and flowers and a good place to get some shade (or warmth in the tropical houses).

The Botanical garden of the University of Basel is the oldest garden  in Switzerland. It is also one of the oldest gardens in the world. It was founded in 1589 by Caspar Bauhin for his research. Today, there are approximately 7500 plant species in the garden. It is located on Spalengraben and Schonbein Strasse.

There are two fossilised tree trunks imported from the USA. These trees lived 210 million years ago in the desert area of Arizona, USA.

Though the garden space is small compared to others, the space has been very well utilised. There are many green houses worth exploring. However, these green houses close an hour earlier than the visiting hours.

The garden is almost part of the university. For example, the environmental sciences department has a doorway to this garden.

I really wondered how could they grow trees in wooden boxes. The trees are short but bear big fruits like lemon, apple and pomegranate. The visit was enjoyable and informative. All the students must visit and learn how great nature is.

Founded in 1589, the Botanical Garden of the University of Basel is one of the oldest botanical gardens in the world. Although it covers a small area, the collection is very rich, with more than 7,500 recorded plants. These include precious and rare species such as Titan Arum, Amazonian Water Lily, Millennium Grass, Giant Sequoia, Ginkgo Biloba, etc. In addition, the botanical garden also has different landscapes such as tropical rainforest, aquatic ecology, and cloud forest. If you want to visit, it is recommended to go around 10:00 in the morning and reserve two hours of sightseeing time, or wait until the afternoon when the sun is not so strong. If you don't understand German, try to bring a translation software to recognize some plant signs. This is a very good place to spend the weekend.

places.generalDescription: St. Alban St√ºbli is a renowned gourmet destination in the 'Dalbe' with a rich history, offering home-style cooking in an elegant setting. The menu features classic dishes like hand-cut beef tartare and veal cordon-bleu with pommes allumettes. Visitors praise the friendly and attentive staff who create a welcoming atmosphere. The restaurant serves elevated Swiss cuisine with some unique twists, featuring meats, local produce, sweet water fish, and fresh pasta.

sources.snippet: Initially run as a beer bar, the St Alban St√ºbli has evolved from a neighbourhood pub into a restaurant for home-style, upscale cuisine. Classic dishes with a twist are served here, representing both the tradition and modernity of this Basel institution.
sources.shortName: The 10 best romance restaurants in Basel

places.name: St. Alban St√ºbli

reviews.text:
Service: Barbara was amazing. I asked for a surprise menu and she delivered. Nothing is more fun than not having to look through a menu card. Thanks Barbara.

Food: was excellent. Well cooked. Well seasoned. Just fantastic.

Atmosphere: was a little bit boring, but the ambiance of the spot is very nice.

Overall: will definitely return.

Thank you for a nice evening.

Amazing, Amazing, Amazing
If you are in Basel or around it I highly suggest to go there. Great food and the good thing limited but generous menu. From appetizer, main to desert. We ordered almost everything as we were 5 people sharing. I can't suggest any dish because the menu is changing but I can assure that all great.  We will go there again for sure. Keep it up üëç

My lunch time visit started off weirdly, I had made a booking I think a day or two earlier and had two confirmation emails.  But when I arrived right on time, I was met with what I would describe as a hostile welcome - they literally said no, it's not possible there is a one person booking for a busy lunch hour. Had to show evidence even before they checked their system (where my booking was).

After this start I was however served by a very helpful younger lady and the food itself was extraordinary, especially the ravioli. Would have loved to give another try at dinner, but didn't have time on my trip.

places.generalDescription: Cheval Blanc by Peter Knogl is an elegant and refined riverside restaurant located in the Grand Hotel Les Trois Rois, offering innovative French cuisine. The restaurant prides itself on exceptional service and sourcing the finest ingredients available on the market. With a maximum capacity of 30 guests, the dining experience is set in a beautiful space adorned with striking chandeliers and high ceilings.

sources.snippet: Dining here is a globetrotting affair that doesn‚Äôt come cheap. Chef Peter Knogl at triple Michelin-starred Cheval Blanc, inside the city‚Äôs flagship luxury hotel Les Trois Rois, keeps the culinary bar high with haute cuisine that lets your taste buds travel far beyond Basel to Mediterranean and Asian lands.
sources.shortName: Top Things to Do in Basel

sources.snippet: Attached to the Les Trois Rois, you‚Äôll also find one of the city‚Äôs most delectable restaurants, The Cheval Blanc. Boasting 3 Michelin stars, a meal here is practically guaranteed to be mouthwatering. There‚Äôs really no better way to show your partner love than a delectable dinner for two.
sources.shortName: Beautiful Historic Basel, Switzerland: A Great Spot for European Couples Getaway

sources.snippet: Unmistakable in style, Peter Knogl and his team remain true to their gastronomic vision and look after the guests at Cheval Blanc like royalty.
sources.shortName: The 10 best romance restaurants in Basel

places.name: Cheval Blanc by Peter Knogl

reviews.text:
Great food, experience and service from all the staff in a beautiful setting. This is up there with the very best Michelin starred restaurants we've had the pleasure to dine at. Each dish was unique and flavourful, the perfect portion size that leaves you waiting in anticipation for the next course.
Thanks to all you all for an experience never to be forgotten.

If I had to pick one word to describe Cheval Blanc, it would be impeccable.  From the  greeting as we arrived a bit early to the flawless dining experience and finally, the unexpected, super enjoyable after dinner drinks and cigar bar, this dining experience was unrivaled.
Our group of 4 came to Basel for one night and were fortunate enough to score a lunch reservation Friday, May 9th. From the moment we stepped into the stunning hotel and absolutely beautiful restaurant we knew our experience would be memorable.
As we arrived early, we were greeted immediately and escorted to the bar area right outside the main restaurant.  It was almost as if they expected us early.  We drank some champagne before entering the main restaurant experience right on time.
The dining room was tastefully decorated and the subtle touches (i.e. candles) made the experience special.  The setting along the Rhine River was just one more Iconic element.   The dining room was full and at the same time entirely intimate. We knew there were other guests in the room with us, but never really felt or heard their presence.
To say the food was amazing is to sell it short.  When you dine at an establishment like Cheval Blanc, you expect the food to be exceptional.  The food on this day was more than up to the task.  Two of us were grateful that the chef allowed us to substitute for our main protein course. The presentation was amazing with each course seemingly looking and tasting better than the previous one.  I will post a few pictures and hope you will accept our apologies for the one course/picture that has a spoon in it.  That course looked (and was) so delicious that we all started eating before we took a picture.  The cheese course was a welcome and unique experience for us.  Note: the picture I posted was AI adjusted as we removed the photobombers (coworkers and other patrons) from the picture.  No cheese was altered by AI.
The wine list was extensive and impressive and our selections matched up well to our menu.
The Cheval Banc team was a perfect accompaniment to the food and drink.  The entire team worked with precision, knowing just when to serve the next course with compelling descriptions.  The team was personal and engaging, yet never intrusive.  Flawless in execution while at the same time graceful in delivery.
Our chef came out at the end of our meal and engaged our table for a few minutes. He was authentically interested in learning about our experience and outwardly pleased we enjoyed our time.

To finish off the day, our group was escorted to the Cigar Bar for drinks and a smoke.  It could not have been a better setting for our nightcap (err, day cap).  The setting was reminiscent of a scene from a James Bod movie.  Yet again, we felt refreshingly alone in a room with multiple groups present and our experience only enhanced by the people serving us.

Our only regret was cutting or trip to Basel short by a day.  Hopefully we will have a chance to return to the wonderful city on a future trip and be lucky enough to dine at Cheval Blanc again.  Maybe we will see you there!

First and foremost, a big thank you to the staff. They made our evening a memorable. The atmosphere was fantastic. The food was delicious. It was elaborately prepared and served by passionate staff. Thank you.

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the heart of Basel, MANOR Basel is a vibrant department store that caters to all your shopping needs. From stylish clothing for men, women, and children to an impressive selection of toys, electronics, and household goods, this store truly has it all. The grocery section offers a curated range of regional products alongside international brands. A highlight is the cafeteria-style restaurant called Manora located on the upper level.

sources.snippet: You can choose a specialty mix of fondue cheeses from the fromageries located in grocery sections of Globus and Manor, or something simpler in any supermarket, like Migros and Coop. They all offer tons of choices and cuisines for even the most hard to please. Many department stores also have an in-house florist for your pick of expert bouquets and arrangements.
sources.shortName: Valentine‚Äôs Day in Basel ‚Äì Basel Community

places.name: MANOR Basel

reviews.text:
Great place to shop for everything. They have a discount offer of 20-30% ongoing from Mar 27 to Mar 30. It's a one stop shop and you get clothing, luxury and accessories here for across age groups. Do visit once.

To claim discount offers, you need a manor card (ask for one, it's free of cost)

A++ service today! I visited to buy a duffel bag for my wife and met Anna, who was incredibly helpful. She guided us to the men's section to find the right colour, even carried the bag on her back to help us judge the size, and engaged kindly with my daughter. She went above and beyond, showing true professionalism and warmth. We purchased the bag and, thanks to this excellent experience, look forward to returning.
I had an excellent experience at Manor thanks to Zsanett in the makeup department. She was so professional and went above and beyond to help me. Truly outstanding service!

places.generalDescription: Stadtcasino Basel is a historic venue that offers a 1500-seat 19th-century concert hall, a ballroom, and chamber music hall. The complex also includes several bars and restaurants such as Papa Joe's and the Campari Bar. The venue underwent a major refurbishment in 2020 by Herzog & de Meuron, resulting in an impressive reinterpretation of the original design.

sources.snippet: Admire the grandeur of Stadtcasino Basel, a symbol of Basel's rich musical heritage. Conclude your tour at Barf√ºsserplatz, a historic square that comes alive with the vibrancy of Basel's modern love and nightlife.
sources.shortName: Romantic Whispers of Basel: A Love-Filled Journey in Basel

sources.snippet: Admire the grandeur of Stadtcasino Basel, a symbol of Basel‚Äôs rich musical heritage. Conclude your tour at Barf√ºsserplatz, a historic square that comes alive with the vibrancy of Basel‚Äôs nightlife.
sources.shortName: 2-hour romantic tour in Basel

sources.snippet: Admire the grandeur of Stadtcasino Basel, a symbol of Basel‚Äôs rich musical heritage. As you pass by, appreciate its historical significance and architectural beauty.
sources.shortName: 2-hour romantic tour in Basel

places.name: Stadtcasino Basel

reviews.text: Gorgeous theatre that is well kept and host to the annual jazz festival as well as a sundry of other venues year round. The seats are comfortable and theatre is clean. The atrium offers beverages for sale during events. Its location in the old town is ideal for walking.
Very intense emotion. The theater is placed in the city center, reachable only by public transport or by walking. The acoustic is very good, the place is elegant and the bar very wide.

Beautiful concert hall in the city center of Basel, with a very elegant style, excellent acoustics, and comfortable seats. It is easy to get to it, they play a lot of good classical music, and the staff is very kind. Can also get relatively cheap tickets to see and listen to wonderful things.

places.generalDescription: The Fine Arts Museum Basel is renowned for housing the world's oldest art collection and is a major attraction in Switzerland. The museum features an extensive range of art, including Medieval, Renaissance, 17th, 18th, and 20th-century pieces as well as modern works. Visitors appreciate the unique architectural design of the museum and enjoy various temporary exhibitions by both renowned and emerging artists.

sources.snippet: Basel has many museums within the city for exploration, many related to art, culture, paintings but also beer!. We personally did not have time to visit any museums, however here is a list of the top ones in Basel that you can visit based on your interests:
sources.shortName: Get Romantic In Basel: Top 10 Activities

places.name: Fine Arts Museum Basel | New Building

reviews.text: Amazing experience, you can find all sorts of artwork and really great architecture. Also you can but tickets on multiple points.
Very nice museum with modern art.

Beautiful & restraint addition to the Basel Kunstmuseun. It may seem like a glumly and boring building from the outside (like a locked bunker when all the windows shutters are closed) but the inside is terrific. Covered in a mono chrome grey the elegant interior fascinates with it's original mixture of chosen materials: rough concrete, grey stone and galvanized steel.

places.generalDescription: The Museum of Cultures Basel, located in Switzerland, is an ethnographic museum with a diverse collection of global artifacts. Established in the 1840s, it houses significant collections from Europe, the South Pacific, Mesoamerica, Tibet and Bali. The museum's origins can be traced back to the city of Basel's Museum of Natural History and Ethnography. Over time, it has expanded its holdings through sponsorships and continuous acquisitions.

sources.snippet: Begin your amorous adventure by meeting your guide at the Museum of Cultures Basel, where diverse expressions of love and culture converge. Stroll hand in hand to the Basel Minster, an architectural marvel that offers a serene and majestic backdrop for shared moments. Whisper sweet nothings at the Palatinate Viewing Platform, with breathtaking views over the Rhine.
sources.shortName: Romantic Whispers of Basel: A Love-Filled Journey in Basel

sources.snippet: Begin your adventure by meeting your guide at the Museum of Cultures Basel, where diverse expressions of love and culture converge. Stroll to the Basel Minster and enjoy views over the Rhine from the Palatinate Viewing Platform. Revel in the whimsy of the Tinguely Fountain, where art and motion create a playful atmosphere.
sources.shortName: 2-hour romantic tour in Basel

sources.snippet: Begin your romantic adventure at the Museum of Cultures Basel, where you'll meet your guide. Here, diverse expressions of love and culture converge, setting the mood for your exploration.
sources.shortName: 2-hour romantic tour in Basel

places.name: Museum of Cultures Basel

reviews.text:
This is an unusual and excellent museum in the centre of Basel, near the cathedral. Each floor has a different exhibition with an interesting theme. The English language leaflets which explain the exhibits are essential reading to get the most from the exhibitions.
I visited several times over the course of one week and it took me several hours to look and read my way around each floor.
Each exhibition is thoughtful, creative and illuminating.
Who would have thought I'd fine a collection of anchors so fascinating?
Excellent place, and the attached bistro is great too!

Whilst there are some very cool items (in particular the fa√ßade of the ceremonial house of Papua New Guinea- the only object with English captions I saw in the whole museum)- I'm glad my friend and I went in for free in the last hour. There are NO English captions/explanations throughout and if I can read German correctly very few objects were before the 19th century. Besides the very cool ceremonial house, the building exterior is the best thing. I didn't see how the arrangement on each floor made sense‚Ä¶ but then again not a German speaker!

A wonderful museum about indigenous cultures from around the world. I was especially touched by the display of Indonesian and Oceanic cultures. I also want to mention that the staff of this museum are very friendly. There are lockers available. The collection is presented in a clear manner and the texts were well written.

places.generalDescription: Nestled in a stylish, riverside hotel, Brasserie Les Trois Rois offers a decadent experience with classic Swiss and French dishes served alongside an impressive selection of beer and wine. Housed in a grand 19th-century building overlooking the Rhine, this brasserie has been frequented by politicians and royalty for over a century. The individually designed rooms exude Neo-classical charm while offering modern amenities.

sources.snippet: The brasserie dishes at Les Trois Rois are contemporary and refreshing without losing their authenticity. The beef tartare, for example, is seasoned right in front of the guest at the table. The view of the Rhine remains unbeatable.
sources.shortName: The 10 best romance restaurants in Basel

places.name: Brasserie Les Trois Rois

reviews.text:
Right on the Rhine River this is my favorite French restaurant in Basel. It is definitely formal and a bit expensive but not expensive compared to restaurants in other larger cities like NYC or Paris or Michelin starred prefix menus. I feel that it is totally worth it especially if you're a tourist and really want to soak in some of the best sites of the city. The restaurant has a very romantic vibe so it would be great for a date, dinner with friends or family, or something more social versus a business location. Our server was extremely polite and all around there was top-notch five star service. Everything that we ordered came out pretty fast and to say that they were very attentive would be an understatement.

I started off my meal with a really nice glass of Bordeaux and it really got my hunger going for what was ahead. For my starter I chose the Saumon Marine which is basically a Salmon Crudo and I thought it was great. It was light and refreshing and woke up my taste buds for my entr√©e, which was the Sole Meuni√®re. I've had this dish many times in my life at many different locations and this was one of the better ones I've had in a long time. It was made perfectly and the flavors lasted throughout the rest of the night. I would highly recommend ordering it and I also would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone. It was one of our more memorable moments of our time in Basel.

An exceptional experience from start to finish-truly one of the finest hotels I've had the pleasure of visiting. I went for high tea, and the service was impeccable. The staff were gracious and attentive, thoughtfully explaining each item with care and precision. They also made sure that the seating provided was comfortable and to my liking. The atmosphere exuded elegance, and the hospitality was second to none. I wholeheartedly recommend this destination to anyone seeking a refined and memorable experience.

My husband and I celebrated a wedding anniversary at The Brasserie. It was a perfect evening; we thoroughly enjoyed the upscale ambience, the view of the beautiful Rhine, the personable service and of course the exquisite food and drinks. We would like to express our gratitude to Mr David and Mr Herv√©: they both made our time at the restaurant extra special with their warm humour and sincere friendliness. The entire team signed a hand-written card for our anniversary - a memory we will cherish forever. Thank you all so much! ‚ù§Ô∏è We think
you are world-class and we can't wait to be back.

places.generalDescription: Restaurant Chez Donati is a beloved establishment that has been serving traditional Piedmont cuisine for over 70 years. The menu features classic pasta, fish, and meat dishes, as well as delightful antipasti and decadent desserts. The elegant atmosphere has received a gentle refresh by new owners in 2020. With stunning views of the Rhine from its sought-after terrace, this Basel institution maintains its long-standing traditions while attracting gourmets near and far.

sources.snippet: Chez Donati is the place to go if you want to enjoy no-frills, high-quality Italian cuisine in Basel. This also includes fast and attentive service, which rightly gives this traditional restaurant cult status. The wine list and terrace are further plus points.
sources.shortName: The 10 best romance restaurants in Basel

places.name: Restaurant Chez Donati

reviews.text: We were difficult and noisy customers (14 people) but the service as IMPECCABLE! They always smiled and were super helpful!  The food was delicious and fresh, desserts were to die for! Would totally go back and recommend it!!

Nice traditional location, professional service, classic Italian menu. The BEST is the desert wagon - a huge selection of deserts to mix and match from, I mixed three pieces (incl an amazing tiramisu), and it's definitely the best part of the entire experience, so leave space!
One star less for the wine selection‚Ä¶ I don't understand how a restaurant can be part of Bindella and not have a broader selection of old wines - it really just doesn't square with the restaurant either.

Really nice restaurant, with a nice deco. The dinner service was done very professional and friendly. The dishes were well presented. The quality was good, but nothing exceptional. The dishes (both pasta and meat) were missing taste. The pasta (tagliatelle, tagliolini) were cook al dente but not much taste.

places.generalDescription: St. Johanns-Park, located near St. Johanns Tor in Basel, is a family-friendly park offering various activities for both kids and adults. The park features a large lawn with sand pits, swings, and fun slides shaped like ducks and pigs for children to enjoy. Visitors can relax at the lovely cafe while sipping on refreshing drinks or reading magazines. The park also provides ample space for picnics and outdoor games, with a flat surface suitable for activities like Kubb.

sources.snippet: The St. Johanns Park is the perfect picnic location on a late summers evening to hang out and enjoy being romantic in Basel. Bring your own treats, snacks, drinks and of course a cosy blanket to sit on. This park is ideal as its right next to the water, close to the old city centre and nice to hang out where the locals also enjoy.
sources.shortName: Get Romantic In Basel: Top 10 Activities

places.name: St. Johanns-Park

reviews.text: Beautiful place for pre river cruise or post River cruise. Very clean and fun for all ages. Very walkable.
Beautiful park right along the rhine , green grass

The park seems so beautiful with a Rhine view.
But dogs are not allowed, so we can't go in
I wish I could understand why dogs are not allowed. Basel is soooo pet friendly, but if it's a small park, dogs are not allowed. But it is what it is.
Unfortunately for the dogs owner!!!!

Sadge
I hope one day they'll change it hopefully !

places.generalDescription: Bottmingen Castle, dating back to the 13th century, is a rare gem in Switzerland and a must-visit for castle enthusiasts. Surrounded by water and parkland, it houses the renowned Restaurant Schloss Bottmingen. The dining experience is highly praised, with exceptional food and friendly service. While the atmosphere may lack some charm, the attentive staff and elaborate surprise menu make it a worthwhile visit. Dining inside this historic castle adds an extra layer of allure to the overall experience.

sources.snippet: The castle dates from the 13th century and is one of the few surviving buildings of its kind in the whole of Switzerland, so it‚Äôs definitely worth the short trip if you enjoy exploring beautiful castles.
sources.shortName: 20+ Unique & Fun Things to do in Basel, Switzerland

places.name: Bottmingen Castle

reviews.text:
Great dinner at the new brasserie.

The fine dining menu is in another league, however. I much prefer it, as the new brasserie takes away from that high-end experience (white tablecloth atmosphere and neatness of fine dining).

We were quite a large group and were not informed about that we'd be at the √† la carte brasserie, expecting the Gourmet restaurant instead.

We had a great time anyhow.

A wonderful restaurant situated in the picturesque Bottmingen Castle.
The food was well presented, tasty and introduced by our waiter before each course, so that we knew what to expect! :)

The staff were lovely. Very attentive without being intrusive.

My friends and I were treated well and I can honestly say that we thoroughly enjoyed the experience.
Amazing place! ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è The service was fantastic; friendly, fast, and cool üòé üëå I loved the food and the vibe üòç

places.generalDescription: The Migros in Basel is a great option if you are looking for a variety of groceries. They have everything from pastries and flowers to meat and seafood. The store is very convenient, and it's perfect for travelers who need a few items to go.

sources.snippet: And all over the city, at any Coop or Migros, you can find melt-in-your-mouth Lindt truffles, Valentine‚Äôs Day specials, and of course chocolate hearts.
sources.shortName: Valentine‚Äôs Day in Basel ‚Äì Basel Community

places.name: Migros Supermarket - Basel - SBB Train Station

reviews.text:
Migros at Basel SBB ‚Äì A Must-Visit for Cakes & Confectioneries!

I had a fantastic experience at the Migros store inside Basel SBB when I was looking for a last-minute cake to take to work for a colleague's birthday. To my surprise, they had a great selection of cakes and pies readily available, making it incredibly easy to find something delicious on short notice.

They carry a wide variety of cakes, pastries, and other confectioneries, so whether you need a cake for a celebration or just want to treat yourself, this is the perfect place to go. The location inside Basel SBB makes it super convenient for anyone on the go.

If you're ever in need of a quality cake or dessert at the last minute, I highly recommend stopping by Migros at Basel SBB!

Food court with seating area on 1st floor with good options. Migros supermarket in the basement. Better to buy snacks drinks and water from the supermarket. It is expensive on the 1st floor food court area.

Lovely place to fill up on delicious food, great selection of hot and cold food, from Kebabs to Pizzas, chicken, vegan and vegetarian food, sandwiches, pasta, coffee and desserts. If you have to eat around the station that's the place to go.

places.generalDescription: If you're on the hunt for a fantastic shopping experience in Basel, look no further than GLOBUS | BASEL DAS PROVISORIUM. This charming store is thoughtfully divided into three distinct sections: the top floor caters to business attire, the ground level offers sporty yet elegant options for more mature men, and the basement is perfect for younger shoppers seeking trendy styles. The friendly and professional staff are always ready to assist you, with an in-house tailor available to ensure your purchases fit just right.

sources.snippet: You can choose a specialty mix of fondue cheeses from the fromageries located in grocery sections of Globus and Manor, or something simpler in any supermarket, like Migros and Coop. They all offer tons of choices and cuisines for even the most hard to please. Many department stores also have an in-house florist for your pick of expert bouquets and arrangements.
sources.shortName: Valentine‚Äôs Day in Basel ‚Äì Basel Community

places.name: GLOBUS | BASEL DAS PROVISORIUM

reviews.text: Location is right in city center. Good quality brands and real discounts. Some of the staff speaks english. Easy to walk artond.

Variety and options in delicatessen that you might not find anywhere else in the city. Quality safe but not necessarily top. Overpriced, probably charging for location and brand. Similar and greater quality food for better prices easily found in other markets around town.

Bought something from their online shop and trying to return within six month due to faulty, they've declined my request from the store as it is the responsible of the e-commerce team.
By the time I manage to reach the online commerce team via phone calls, they insist on saying that my order was over a year long(which it isn't, because tomorrow is when I placed an order a year ago), because of the wrongly interpretation hence why they are not able to do anything for this item. Ridiculous irresponsible customer service and would not recommend for anybody that wish to have a smooth customer experience or warranty for their products. Buy from Galaxus at least they won't brush you off like this‚Ä¶.
